name: JRubyOnRails
text: You can use JRuby with [http://www.rubyonrails.org/ Ruby on Rails]! __TOC__ ==Advantages== Gives Rails the power and functionality of Java Platform: * Excellent Garbage collection for endless uptimes * Hotspot profiled dynamic optimizations for great performance * Access to Java ecosphere for additional technology options * Deploy to Java App Servers for ubiquity ==Getting Started== [http://blog.emptyway.com/2008/04/08/120-seconds-guide-to-jruby-on-rails| 120 seconds guide to JRuby on Rails] == Deployment == === War File Deployment === If you do not use a traditional Ruby application server like mongrel, you can use a Java application server (JAS). To deploy to a JAS you can use the tool [[Warbler]] to bundle up your Rails application in a Java Web Application Archive (e.g. .war file). Once you have a .war file you can deploy to any JAS using their war deployment mechanism. More info: * [[Warbler]] (minimal, flexible, ruby-like way to create .war file) Here is information of various JAS: * [http://atalks.prokhorenko.us/2009/02/ruby-on-rails-application-migrating.html Tomcat] * [[JRuby on Rails on Jetty|Jetty]], [[JRuby on Rails in GlassFish|Glassfish]] * [[JRuby on Rails on WebSphere|Websphere]] * [http://wiki.oracle.com/page/JRuby+on+Rails%3A+Deploying+to+Oracle+Containers+for+Java+EE+%28OC4J%29 Oracle OC4J] * [[JRuby on Rails on BEA Weblogic|Weblogic]] * [http://oddthesis.org/theses/jboss-rails JBoss] * [http://blogs.sun.com/sabada/entry/deploying_jruby_on_rails_war JWS 7] === Traditional Rails Deployment === '''Looking for content and pages to GFV3 gem, mongrel, webrick, etc...''' == Miscellaneous Rails Topics == '''Important note about [[Rails_2_3_2|Rails 2.3.2]]''' * JNDI -
